publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-619 Pauline McNeill: Highlanders' Institute—That the Parliament supports the venture of the Highlanders’ Institute to establish premises in Glasgow for the promotion of Highland and Islands culture and languages and notes that the aim of the Highlanders’ Institute is to include all Scots and non-Scots interested in Highland culture and languages.
S1M-619 Highlanders' Institute (lodged on 1 March 2000) Michael Russell*

S1M-619 Pauline McNeill: Highlanders' Institute—That the Parliament supports the venture of the Highlanders’ Institute to establish premises in Glasgow for the promotion of Highland and Islands culture and languages and notes that the aim of the Highlanders’ Institute is to include all Scots and non-Scots interested in Highland culture and languages. Supported by: Michael Russell
S1M-619 Highlanders' Institute (lodged on 1 March 2000) Linda Fabiani*, Rhoda Grant*
S1M-619 Highlanders' Institute (lodged on 1 March 2000) Robert Brown*
S1M-619 Highlanders' Institute (lodged on 1 March 2000) Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*, Fergus Ewing*

S1M-619 Pauline McNeill: Highlanders' Institute—That the Parliament supports the venture of the Highlanders’ Institute to establish premises in Glasgow for the promotion of Highland and Islands culture and languages and notes that the aim of the Highlanders’ Institute is to include all Scots and non-Scots interested in Highland culture and languages. Supported by: Michael Russell, Linda Fabiani, Rhoda Grant, Robert Brown, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Fergus Ewing, Alex Neil*, Donald Gorrie*, George Lyon*
